li.text: - Antenna (Fluted) - Ears (Curved) - Eyes (Large + Colors) - Distinct Cheekbones - Long Snout
With RimWorld 1.5 the opportunity to change things with minimal impact has finally arrived, I've been waiting for a major version update to do these for many months now.

Genes relating to reproduction have seen significant changes, asexual reproduction is now its own gene, which adds a gizmo to trigger pregnancy (or whatever their method of reproduction is). Xenotype Eggs aren't an option now, it may be reimplemented in future in a way compatible with other methods of reproduction, but it already took a couple days from me trying to get it to work, I'm not wasting more time on it for now.

I've replaced the skin colours completely, the old ones were based on vanilla ColorDef data, which sucks. So the new palette is one created with MATH! However, I'm bad at math, and colourblind so if they're accurately assigned at all then it's completely by luck alone. This has also been done with the hairs.

A smaller but still substantial overhaul to the Ascension genes has also been done, now you can have multiple, and choose which one they'll ascend to in the hediff with a dropdown, it'll be random if one isn't chosen. There's also now additional genes (and a setting) for increasing and decreasing life experience gain, as well as skipping that part of the mechanic entirely if none of the "Earned Ascension" genes are on the xenotype.

- Insect Wings - Silver, Gold and Copper Skin - New Headbone type "Crown" with several variations - Ability: Lightning Spray (Works like an EMP wave) - Ability: Toxic Spray (Tox Gas) - Ability: Freezing Spray (Freezes Pawns Temporarily)
- Pawns with All Male/All Female genes should now generate properly. - Several typo fixes. - Some descriptions are now clearer.
- New Ears (Large) - Back feathers - Facial tendrils - Insect Body
- Scaleskin (furskin but scales) - Scalebody (scaleskin without a forced head type) - Insect body
- Fixed missing icon for Calming Pheromones
- Furbody (furskin without a forced head type) - New Ears (Teddy) - New Nose (Leathery) - Calming Pheromones (makes non-matching xenotypes like the carrier more)

- Humanoid/Xenotype eggs now have their own storage category so they aren't included in food recipes. - Xenotype Eggs will now be laid on the spot if no appropriate, reachable egg box can be found. - Xenotype Egg laying now takes into account fertility, hiding the gizmo on sterile pawns. - Humanoid/Xenotype eggs now properly show the amount of time remaining for different pregnancy rates.
- New Tails (Pointed, Furball) - New Ears (Webbed) - New Wings (Fallen Angel, Devil) - Chest Fur

- Arachnid Head gene - Arachnid Eyes genes (includes color genes for the eye color) - Feybark Head gene - Ear genes (flat pointed, big, flufftop and serrated) - Nose genes (big and nasal slits) - Squat body scale gene - Destiny Marks skin gene (natural markings across body and head) - Kind Eyes gene (makes others more likely to like the carrier) - Furry Beards gene (Furskin beards but without the furskin needed) - Leafy Protrusions gene (replaces hair with leaves) - Feline Fur gene (Furskin but with a cat-like head) - Recessed Eyes (visual gene for eyes, works with eye colors) - Egg-layer gene (instead of being pregnant, unlike the asexual one already in the mod) - Familiar scent (makes matching xenotypes friendlier with one another) - Pregnancy rate genes (affects the times for eggs and implanting reproduction methods too!) - Maturation rate genes (faster and slower) - Fey Ageing (age normally up to 18, then aging gradually slows till 28 when it stops completely) - Ridged Skin (ridges on both the body and face) - More Metabolism offset genes
- Chitinous Skin - Crabby looking skin gene, comes with two variants, white underbelly and tinted underbelly.
- You can no longer command non-colonist xenotype egg layers to squeeze one out. - A letter similar to that of a normal birth will now display when a xenotype egg hatches.
